memberdef.argsstring: (Program &program, const std::variant< CoreCoord, CoreRange, CoreRangeSet > &core_spec, const CircularBufferConfig &config)
memberdef.name: CreateCircularBuffer

detaileddescription.para: Creates a Circular Buffer (CB) in L1 memory of all cores within core ranges (inclusive) and adds it to the program. There can be a total of NUM_CIRCULAR_BUFFERS (32) circular buffers per core. Circular buffers hold data and have an associated config which indicates usage of the address space. If the config is specified for multiple buffer indices, the circular buffer address space is shared and each buffer index can potentially have a unique view of the shared space.

Circular buffers can be dynamically allocated or program-local allocated. If the config is created with an L1 buffer or sets a globally allocated address it is dynamic and shares the same address space as the L1 buffer. Otherwise, the circular buffer address space is managed by the program. Address space for program-local circular buffers does not persist across programs.
Return value: Circular Buffer ID (uintptr_t)

entry.para: The program to which buffer will be added to
Either a single logical core, a range of logical cores or a set of logical core ranges that indicate where the circular buffer will be configured

memberdef.argsstring: (Program &program, CBHandle cb_handle)
memberdef.name: GetCircularBufferConfig

detaileddescription.para: Gets a reference to the config owned by circular buffer at the given circular buffer ID.
Return value: const CircularBufferConfig &

entry.para: The program containing the circular buffer
ID of the circular buffer, returned by CreateCircularBuffers

memberdef.argsstring: (Program &program, CBHandle cb_handle, uint32_t total_size)
memberdef.name: UpdateCircularBufferTotalSize

detaileddescription.para: Update the total size of the circular buffer at the given circular buffer handle. Updating a program-local circular buffer requires all circular buffers in the program to be reallocated.
Return value: void

Argument
Description
Type
Valid Range
Required
program
The program containing the circular buffer
Program &
Yes
| cb_handle | ID of the circular buffer, returned by CreateCircularBuffers | CBHandle (uintptr_t) | | Yes | | | total_size | New size of the circular buffer in bytes | uint32_t | | Yes |

memberdef.name: UpdateCircularBufferPageSize

detaileddescription.para: Update the page size at specified buffer_index of the circular buffer at the given circular buffer handle.
Return value: void

entry.para: The program containing the circular buffer
ID of the circular buffer, returned by CreateCircularBuffers
Circular buffer index to update page size. cb_handle must be a circular buffer that had previously programmed this index

Return value: void

Argument
Description
Type
Valid Range
Required
program
The program containing the circular buffer
Program &
Yes
| cb_handle | ID of the circular buffer, returned by CreateCircularBuffers | CBHandle (uintptr_t) | | Yes | | | buffer | Dynamically allocated L1 buffer that shares address space of circular buffer cb_handle | const Buffer & | L1 buffer | Yes |

memberdef.name: SetRuntimeArgs

detaileddescription.para: Set runtime args for a kernel that are sent to the core during runtime. This API needs to be called to update the runtime args for the kernel. Maximum of 255 allowed runtime args per core (unique and common runtime args count toward same limit).
Return value: void

entry.para: The program containing kernels, circular buffers, semaphores
ID of the kernel that will receive the runtime args
Location of Tensix core(s) where the runtime args will be written
Any logical Tensix core coordinate(s) on which the kernel is placed
The runtime args to be written

Return value: void

entry.para: The program containing kernels, circular buffers, semaphores
ID of the kernel that will receive the runtime args
Location of Tensix core(s) where the runtime args will be written
Any set of logical Tensix core coordinates on which the kernel is placed
The runtime args to be written
Outer vector size must be equal to size of core_spec vector

memberdef.argsstring: (Device *device, const uint8_t cq_id, const uint32_t trace_buff_size)
memberdef.name: BeginTraceCapture

detaileddescription.para: Begins capture on a trace, when the trace is in capture mode all programs pushed into the trace queue will have their execution delayed until the trace is instantiated and enqueued. The capture must be later ended via EndTraceCapture, and finally scheduled to be executed via ReplayTrace. Beginning a trace capture enabled buffer allocations until capture has ended.
Return value: Trace ID

entry.para: The command queue id associated with the trace.
The size of the trace buffer to pre-allocate.

memberdef.argsstring: (Device *device, const uint8_t cq_id, const uint32_t tid)
memberdef.name: EndTraceCapture

detaileddescription.para: Completes capture on a trace, if captured commands do not conform to the rules of the trace, the trace will be invalidated. This trace can be enqueued for execution via ReplayTrace on the same device command queue. After ending a trace capture, buffer allocations on device are disabled until either a new trace begins capture, or all traces on the device are released
Return value: void

entry.para: The command queue id associated with the trace.
A unique id from BeginTraceCapture for the trace being captured

memberdef.argsstring: (Device *device, const uint8_t cq_id, const uint32_t tid, const bool blocking)
memberdef.name: ReplayTrace

detaileddescription.para: Replay a trace of previously generated commands and data.
Return value: void

entry.para: The command queue id associated with the trace.
A unique id representing an existing captured trace.
Whether or not this is a blocking operation

memberdef.argsstring: (Device *device, const uint32_t tid)
memberdef.name: ReleaseTrace

detaileddescription.para: Release a previously instantiated trace, deallocating the associated trace buffers on device This operation is not thread-safe, user must ensure that the trace being released is no longer needed by device threads If this releases the last trace on a device, then buffer allocations are re-enabled
Return value: void

entry.para: A unique id representing an existing captured trace.

memberdef.argsstring: (CommandQueue &cq, uint32_t trace_id, bool blocking)
memberdef.name: EnqueueTrace

detaileddescription.para: Enqueues a trace of previously generated commands and data.
Return value: void

entry.para: The command queue object which dispatches the command to the hardware
A unique id representing an existing on-device trace, which has been
instantiated via InstantiateTrace where the trace_id is returned
Whether or not this is a blocking operation

Type
Valid Range
Required
cq
The command queue object which dispatches the command to the hardware
CommandQueue &
Yes
and waits for the event to complete.
event

std::shared_ptr<Event>
Yes
